markdown:
# The Fellowship's Journey

  The Fellowship of the Ring was formed at the Council of Elrond in
  Rivendell. The council included representatives from all the Free Peoples
  of Middle-earth.

  ## Key Members

  Gandalf the Grey led the fellowship on their quest to destroy the One
  Ring. The wizard had traveled extensively throughout Middle-earth and
  possessed great wisdom.

  Aragorn, the heir of Isildur, joined as the group's ranger and guide. He
  would later become King of Gondor after the War of the Ring.

  The hobbits Frodo Baggins, Samwise Gamgee, Merry Brandybuck, and Pippin
  Took represented the Shire. Frodo carried the burden of the Ring itself.

  ## The Quest

  The fellowship departed from Rivendell and traveled through dangerous
  lands. They passed through Moria, where they faced the Balrog in the Mines
   of Moria.

  After crossing through Lothl√≥rien, they journeyed down the River Anduin.
  The Lady Galadriel had warned them of the trials ahead.

  The fellowship eventually broke at Amon Hen, where Boromir fell to the
  Ring's temptation and Frodo decided to continue alone with Sam.

  ## Major Events

  - The Battle of Helm's Deep tested the strength of Rohan
  - The Siege of Gondor threatened Minas Tirith
  - The destruction of the Ring at Mount Doom ended Sauron's reign

  The courage and friendship displayed throughout this journey would be
  remembered for ages.
